title: Paging @Riot Tantram
body:
Alright im bored and you seem to desperately need upvotes, I give you permission to post the logs that led to my permanent ban.

Well there we go, we can see their system is a failure. A permanent ban off 1 chat log, good stuff

Thats it? That first log is what gave me the 2 week ban so why would that count against my perm ban? 

So you are legit telling me I was perm banned based off 1 chat log? Insane

not to mention my team was insanely toxic in that first log, I'm sure that rengar/ezreal are still out there playing somewhere. I see you convienently left out their text

I posted what you asked for.

> logs that led to my permanent ban.

Your 14-day ban led to your perma ban.

Your perma-ban would have likely been a chat restriction, but because you so recently were 14-day banned it was escalated to the next level of punishment.

I checked all of your recent games, and in almost every game you are blaming others.
Here are some excerpts from your last few games, that weren't included:

you're garbage
didnt carry shit
dumass, classic
team sucks
surrender
this syupport is so garbage
holy shit report this guy
snapchat me tits

You were also reported in a huge number of games.

So again, I ask what is the point of chat restrictions if you don't use them for a chat based problem? How is 2 chat logs worthy of a perm ban? as I thought the system is completely broken.

Meanwhile there are people that AFK in diamond, troll on purpose, and do other things but as long as they dont say anything "mean" they are fine to keep playing.  But im sure you think this is a working system for some delusional reason

{{champion:33}} ok

> [{quoted}](name=Gotodead,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=QIG5j3o8,comment-id=0004000000000001,timestamp=2016-03-10T22:27:06.089+0000)
>
> So again, I ask what is the point of chat restrictions if you don't use them for a chat based problem? How is 2 chat logs worthy of a perm ban? as I thought the system is completely broken.
> 
> Meanwhile there are people that AFK in diamond, troll on purpose, and do other things but as long as they dont say anything "mean" they are fine to keep playing.  But im sure you think this is a working system for some delusional reason

They do use chat restrictions, but only for the first few punishments. The punishment order goes like this:

1.) 10 game chat restriction
2.) 25 game chat restriction
3.) 14 day ban
4.) Permanent ban

You start off with the chat restriction for the first punishment, and the more times you break the rules, the harsher the punishment. Since you had a 14 day ban recently, your next punishment was a permanent ban. The permanent ban isn't because of one or two chat logs alone, it's because you were punished multiple times beforehand but you failed to recognize that your behavior is unacceptable and showed no signs of changing it.

Also, those who troll on purpose do get punished. The problem with these people is that it can be quite difficult to catch a pattern of trolling over multiple games (note that I say pattern, as people are generally not punished for a single instance unless it is quite extreme), thus it will take longer for them to be punished. People who are toxic in chat are much easier to catch, thus they are punished quicker.

As for AFK's, they too get punished, but there is a different punishment for those who AFK. They receive a what is referred to as a low priority queue, which for this game means they have to wait a certain amount of time before they actually enter the queue.
never received a chat restriction as confirmed by the rioter.
But you did receive a 14-day ban, no?

yes but I never argued that. I just said whats the point of a chat restriction system for chat infractions if its not even used? But whatever I got my entertainment out of this thread. Already have 8 pentas on my new account low elo is hilarious.

They **are** used, though.
They are used when Riot expects them to actually be practical.
Chat restrictions are to aid people in reforming. If Riot doesn't believe that will work for you (based on their statistics, and shit), they will skip these punishment tiers. That's what happened here, obviously.

How would they know if they never tried it? 2 week ban obviously didnt do anything because it just made me more pissed off and I simply played on a different account for 2 weeks, does nothing to reform.
So what should Riot do to punish you?

Lyte should start off by going back to school and realizing that negative reinforcement only makes people resent the system more. They won't actually truly reform, only conform to the standards set forth by it temporarily. 

Positive reinforcement has always been the way to go if you want people to truly change their behavior. But they quickly scrapped the honor system/program because they realized it wouldn't make them any money and they are lowlife corporates.

> [{quoted}](name=Gotodead,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=QIG5j3o8,comment-id=000400000000000100010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T15:17:57.999+0000)

You're notorious on the boards for being an asshole an I think its really funny, enjoy your ban!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
nice meme, I barely posted on the forums before this. Notorious is not the right word when very little people would recognize my name.
So you're saying you shouldn't be punished at all.

The punishment should fit the crime. Permanently remove my chat if thats causing so many problems. Why they think barring my account when I try my hardest in every game to win and I never grief/afk is beyond me. Before you bring up my logs I didnt actually afk just said that out of frustration.

Now what you get instead is me bashing the shit out of silver/gold players and ruining 30+ games already where I destroy the other team singlehandedly. Did that solve the problem?
Are you still being toxic in those games?

They don't. Hence why I didn't use the word "know".
However statistics dictate what is a practical approach. That's the answer to both, the fact that you didn't receive chat restrictions, and also why they didn't jump to a permaban right away.

Hypothetical example with made up numbers:

Let's say that of all the people that say the word "retard", 0.1% reform after receiving chat restrictions. 49.9% reform after a 14-day ban. 50% end up permabanned over the course of the entire "standard" 4-strike approach.
Additionally, let's say that when skipping the chat restrictions, 50% reform after the 14-day ban.

So... what would in this scenario be your approach to people that say the word "retard"?
The 0.1% that wouldn't "need" the 14-day ban don't really warrant letting the 50% continue to rage until they finally get permabanned. But the 50% on the other hand warrant not jumping straight to a permaban.
So instead of the previous approach, you simply go straight to a 14-day ban.

Of course, neither the "identifier" nor the statistics will be as straight forward as this example. But the concept stays the same. It's an optimization problem, where you want to minimize the amount of games ruined by players, while also trying to maximize the amount of people that reform.

Which is absolutely horrible if thats actually how the system works, as its specifically directed at maximizing profits in a negative reinforcement system. Then they wonder why toxicity hasn't decreased at all in this game.

They can pull the weeds constantly all they want, but if they don't solve the root problem of the trolls/griefers that make people upset in the first place then it doesn't matter.

Where exactly do you read profits in there?
This optimization problem exists regardless of Riot, or even games. Even if you don't believe that punishment should be minimized, reforming is **always** preferable to permanent punishment.
At the same time, oviously a lower amount of overall offenses that are commited is preferable as well.

Now make those offenses murders and the permanent punishment a life in prison or death penalty. Again, you need to balance between trying to reform those who are still capable of reforming and keeping those who are inable to reform off the street.

The argument about trolls being the root of the problem is so old...
A) Trolls are not the root of all raging. A lot of people rage at bad players.
B) It's impossible to remove all trolls, so the problem of retaliating ragers will also persist.
C) The "symptom" of ragers is still ruining the experience for a lot of people.

It's simple: Treating a disease is important. But if the symptoms start fucking you over, you have to start also treating symptoms.

Simple really, positive reinforcement means rewarding players that aren't assholes.  That cuts into profit even though it is the more effective way to go about things, so cant have that.

Instead they use the far inferior negative reinforcement because it doesn't cut into profits at all. Most of these players wouldn't give Riot a dime to begin with, and it protects against players that will spend money by giving the illusion that Riot is "cleaning up the streets" = happier customers.

I can't speak for everyone but im talking about me specifically. I only get upset at people that obviously are just fucking around. In this case a premade that didnt speak english and was insulting me in a foreign language while intentionally avoiding top lane while i got repeatedly 2/3  man dove because the other team was also on comms. obviously not fun.

In the end its a bunch of mumbo jumbo for too lazy to create a poper system, just use a terrible word filter system and allow everything else to permeate.

But.. you are taking it out of context of course ;)

"Context" is irrelevant here. You are never punished for what other players do, only your personal actions. Your own personal chatlogs are all that's needed because those are the only things considered when giving your punishment. You always have the option to mute a player, and certainly no one is in the room with you forcing you to engage in verbal abuse and/or unsportmanlike conduct.

It doesn't matter what it was in response to, it shouldn't have been said at all.
